#### Final Shade Map

```{r leaflet, include = FALSE}
library(dplyr); library(leaflet); library(leafem); library(plainview); library(mapview); library(terra)

clim_res <- rast("C:/Users/mlefcoe.stu/Documents/Shade_Mapping_R/Results/test_result_ag.tif")

ramp <- colorNumeric(palette = c("#CFFDD7","#00000099"),na.color = "#00000000", domain = 1:100, alpha = TRUE)

m <- leaflet() %>%
  addProviderTiles("Esri.WorldImagery") %>%
  addScaleBar(position = c("bottomleft")) %>%
  setView(-123.245891, 49.262280, zoom = 13.6) %>% 
  addRasterImage(clim_res, colors = ramp)
```

```{r map, echo = FALSE}
m
```

Interactive webmap of climate change resilient shade across campus. Dark areas represent a high density of tall, climate change resilient tree species that tend to cast more shade.
